title: Shopify Cancels Plans to Move Into Massive New Office Space in Downtown Toronto
description: The logo of Shopify outside its headquarters in Ottawa on Sept. 28, 2018. (Chris Wattie/Reuters)

title: Ontario Judge Grants Another Permanent Injunction in Two-Year Land Dispute
description: An Indigenous Mohawk called by the name Wack camps out at a construction site at the centre of an Indigenous land dispute in Caledonia, Ont., Oct. 29, 2020. (The Canadian/Nathan Denette)

title: In Crowded NB Hospital, 88-Year-Old Awaiting Nursing Home Placed in Supply Room
description: Irene MacNeill, 88, of Barnesville, N.B., lays in bed as nurses move the bed to access an electrical outlet after she was placed in a supply room at an over capacity Saint John Regional Hospital, in Saint John, N.B., in a Dec. 15, 2022, handout photo. (The Canadian Press/HO-Karen Totten)

title: Toronto Police Arrest Suspect in Random Subway Attacks
description: A Toronto Transit Commission streetcar is seen in a file photo. (The Canadian Press//Doug Ives)

title: Michael Taube: The Clock Is Ticking on TikTok in US. Shouldn’t Canada Do the Same?
description: The TikTok logo at the video hosting service's UK office in London, England, on Feb. 9, 2022. (Tolga Akmen/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Four Edmonton Children in Government Care After Drug Trafficking Bust
description: Edmonton police seizes $11,000 in coins from an alleged drug trafficking residence in central Edmonton on Nov. 17, 2022. (Edmonton Police Service)

title: MPs Report: Britain Should Officially Designate China as ‘Threat’
description: A view of The Houses of Parliament in early morning sunshine. (John Walton/PA)

title: 19-Year-Old Charged in Connection With English Channel Boat Deaths
description: Members of the Dover lifeboat place a body bag on a stretcher after returning to the Port of Dover following a large search and rescue operation launched in the English Channel off the coast of Dungeness, in Kent, southeast England, on Dec. 14, 2022. (Gareth Fuller/PA Media)

title: Anthony Furey: The Year School Board Issues and Parents’ Rights Began Making a Comeback
description: Students arrive for at an elementary school in Mississauga, Ont., on Jan. 19, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Nathan Denette)

title: Australian State Government Spends $200 Million to Boost Flood Response
description: Flooding is shown by helicopter around Maitland, Australia, on July 8, 2022. (David Swift-Pool/Getty Images)

title: Australia Prioritising Teachers, Health Care Workers for Visa Applications
description: Emergency medical staff and Callum Cherrett Cardiology AT (C) treat a patient with suspected heart issues in the Emergency Department of St Vincent's Hospital in Sydney, Australia, on June 4, 2020. (Lisa Maree Williams/Getty Images)

title: Taiwan Legislators Propose Criminal Law Against Forced Organ Harvesting
description: Taiwan lawmakers led by legislator Hsu Chih-chieh (L5) held a press conference at Taipei Legislative Yuan to rally for support for the proposed criminal law against forced organ harvesting on Dec. 9, 2022. Legislators Chang Liao Wan-chien (R1), Kuo Kuo-wen (R2), Chen Su-yueh (R3), Lai Hui-yuan (L3), and Chen Jiau-hua (L4) attended, along with human rights attorney Theresa Chu (L2) and Huang Chien-feng (L1) from Taiwan Association for International Care of Organ Transplants. (NTD Television)

title: Heating Restored in Freezing Kyiv After Russia Launches Another Major Attack: Mayor Klitschko
description: Municipal workers install a Christmas tree during a heavy fog at the Sofiyska square in Kyiv, Ukraine, on Dec. 17, 2022. (Gleb Garanich/Reuters)

title: North Korea Fires 2 Ballistic Missiles, South Korea Condemns Tensions
description: A woman walks past a TV broadcasting a news report on North Korea firing a ballistic missile off its east coast, in Seoul, South Korea, on Dec. 18, 2022. (Heo Ran/Reuters)

title: British Troops to Cover for Striking Ambulance Drivers and Border Staff
description: Ambulances at St Thomas' Hospital in London, England, on Jan. 7, 2022. (Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)

title: Iran Authorities Arrest Actress of Oscar-Winning Movie
description: Taraneh Alidoosti poses for photographers upon arrival at the premiere of the film 'Leila's Brothers' at the 75th international film festival, in Cannes, southern France, on May 25, 2022. (Daniel Cole/AP Photo, File)

title: Australian Child Among Over 100 Sick From Contaminated Spinach, Recall Announced
description: Baby spinach grows in a field. (David Paul Morris/Getty Images)

title: US, German Embassies in China Suspend Visa Services as COVID Infections Soar
description: A Chinese security guard gestures outside the U.S. embassy in Beijing on Sept. 12, 2020. (Greg Baker/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Alpha Brand Plant-Based Breakfast Sandwich Recalled Over Undeclared Milk
description: Canadian Food Inspection Agency in Ottawa on June 26, 2019. (The Canadian Press/Sean Kilpatrick)

title: Grocery Shoplifting on the Rise in Canada Amid Inflation, Industry Insiders Say
description: People shop at a Loblaws store in Toronto on May 3, 2018. (The Canadian Press/Nathan Denette)

title: New Study Reveals Which Countries Most Influenced by China
description: (From left) Russian President Vladimir Putin, Chinese leader Xi Jinping, Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro, South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa, and India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi pose for a family picture during the 11th BRICS Summit in Brasilia, Brazil, on Nov. 14, 2019. (Sergio Lima/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Japan Plans to Replace Aged Nuclear Reactors to Stabilize Energy Supply
description: Nuclear reactors of No. 5 (center L) and 6 look over tanks storing water that was treated but still radioactive, at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant in Okuma town, Fukushima prefecture, northeastern Japan, on Feb. 27, 2021. (Hiro Komae/AP Photo)
